entries: This medal can be worn on your person or attached to a shield or weapon. You gain +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with an attached weapon (provided it doesn't already give a bonus to such rolls), and you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your paladin spells. In addition, you can use the charm or weapon as a spellcasting focus for your paladin spells.

You can use your Paladin's Smite feature without expending a use. When you do so, the spell is cast as part of the {@action Attack|XPHB} action instead of a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Potion of Excessive Growth
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the effects of the {@spell Unreasonable Scale|J:General} spell (no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required).

item.name: Wrathblood Poison
entries: A creature subjected to Wrathblood Poison makes a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or goes {@condition Berserk|J:General} (5) for one minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns (after taking damage from the condition if it would) ending the effect on itself on a success.

item.name: Greater Wrathblood Poison
entries: A creature subjected to Wrathblood Poison makes a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or goes {@condition Berserk|J:General} (10) for one minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns (after taking damage from the condition if it would) ending the effect on itself on a success.

item.name: Horn of the Commander
entries: This horn has 6 charges and regains {@dice 1d6} charges daily at dawn. As an action, you can expend a number of charges up to your Proficiency Bonus (minimum of 3) to cast the {@spell Summon Warrior|J:Humanoids} spell. For 3 charges, you cast the spell at 3rd-level. You can increase the spell's level by 1 for each additional charge you expend.

ac.special: 12 + the level of the spell + 2 (Sentry only)

hp.special: 30 + 10 for each spell level above 3rd + 10 (Berserker Only)

trait.name: Magical Origin
entries: The spirit is immune to the effects of the {@spell hold person|XPHB} spell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (round down).

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atkr ms, rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + 3 + summonSpellLevel} magical piercing damage.

action.name: Greataxe (Berserker Only)
entries: {@atkr ms} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@damage 1d12 + 3 + summonSpellLevel} magical slashing damage.

action.name: Halberd (Sentry Only)
entries: {@atkr ms} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 10 ft. {@h}{@damage 1d10 + 3 + summonSpellLevel} magical slashing damage.

bonus.name: Warrior's Frenzy (Berserker Only)
entries: The spirit takes the {@action Dash|XPHB} action and gains advantage on its next attack roll on the current turn.

bonus.name: Trickster's Feint (Scoundrel Only)
entries: The spirit takes the {@action Disengage|XPHB} or {@action Help|XPHB} action. An attack roll aided by this Help action deals additional damage equal to twice the spell's level on a hit.

reaction.name: Sentinel's Strike (Sentry Only)
entries: When a creature the spirit can see enters its reach or makes an attack against a creature other than the spirit while within its reach, the spirit can make a special opportunity attack.

monster.name: Plant Spirit

ac.special: 12 + the level of the spell + 1 (Tree Only)

languages: understands the languages you know but does not speak

trait.name: Crushing Branches (Tree Only)
entries: The spirit deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Thorny Undergrowth (Shrub Only)
entries: The ground within 15 feet of the spirit is difficult terrain for creatures other than you and the spirit. Additionally, the spirit deals an additional {@dice 1d8} damage with {@variantrule Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (round down).

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr ms} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + 4 + summonSpellLevel} bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Grasping Vines (Vines Only)
entries: {@atkr ms} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@damage 1d4 + 4 + summonSpellLevel} bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition Grappled|XPHB} (escape DC equals your spell save DC).

A {@condition Grappled|XPHB} creature is also {@condition Lingering|J:General|Lingering (spell's level Bludgeoning)}. The maximum number of creatures the spirit can have grappled in this way at the same time is equal to the spell's level.

action.name: Timber (Tree Only)
entries: The sprit rapidly grows and then falls on its enemies. Each creature in a 20-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take a number of {@dice d6}s equal to the spell's level bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition Prone|XPHB}. A creature takes half damage and is not knocked {@condition Prone|XPHB} on a success. Objects in the area that are not being worn or carried also take this damage. The spirit then returns to its previous size and position.

trait.name: Formation Tactics
entries: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, grappled, or restrained while it is within 5 feet of at least one ally.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The captain makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}), piercing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) blugeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Kopis
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Shape Up Maggots
entries: Whenever a friendly creature within 30 feet of the captain that can hear it misses with an attack, the captain can yell perilous threats to allow that creature to reroll the attack roll.

action.name: Kopis
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Kopis

trait.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Serve the Master
entries: The warforged knows a humanoid creature as its master. The warforged must protect the master with its life, and must obey the master's every order, unless it directly threatens the life of the master.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warforged makes two armblade attacks.

action.name: Armblade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Protect The Master
entries: When a creature makes an attack roll against the warforged's master and the warforged is able to reach them using their remaining movement, the warforged can use their reaction and their movement to block the incoming attack, taking the hit (or miss) themselves. The warforged's AC is used to determine if the attack hits or misses.

action.name: Final Protocol
entries: When all hope is lost, the warforged can perform one final act to hinder their enemies. The warforged can overload their core to explode.

Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the warforged must make a DC12 Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
This action kills the warforged and shatters their body into a thousand pieces.

reaction.name: Protection
entries: When an attacker the warforged can see makes an attack roll against a creature within 5 feet of the warforged, the warforged can impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

entries: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned|phb} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the horse moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone|phb}. If the target is {@condition prone|phb}, the horse can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) blugeoning damage.

languages: understands Common but can't speak it

trait.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned|phb} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the boar moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone|phb}.

action.name: Tusk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned|phb} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

action.name: Bite

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the jackalope can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Familiar
entries: With the DM's permission, the {@spell find familiar|phb} spell can summon a jackalope.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The jackalope has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

action.name: Ventriloquy
entries: The jackalope can cast the {@spell minor illusion|phb} cantrip at will without providing somatic or material components. When it does so, the spell has a range of 60ft but it can only create voices and sounds. The jackalope's spell save DC for this casting is 16.

action.name: Antlers
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Bad Flier
entries: The chicken falls at the end of a turn if it's airborne and the only thing holding it aloft is its flying speed.

trait.name: Headless
entries: If the chicken is reduced to 0 hit points by non-magical damage, it does not die immediately. Instead, it remains alive but headless for {@dice 1d4} rounds, or until it takes additional damage from any source. While headless, the chicken is {@condition blinded|phb}, {@condition deafened|phb}, cannot use its peck attack, cannot restore hit points and must move at least 20ft in a random direction on each of its turns.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Doomerang
entries: You can cast the {@spell Boomerang Blade|Jackalope} cantrip at will using one of your pact weapons. When you do so the range of the attack is doubled.

optionalfeature.name: Potent Weapon
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.
Choose one of the following damage types when creating the weapon: acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison.

This weapon has 4 charges. When making a weapon attack with this weapon, you can expend one charge to deal an additional {@dice 1d6} of the chosen damage type. The weapon regains {@dice 1d4} charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Agile Fighting
entries: All melee weapons that lack the heavy, two-handed or special properties gain the finesse property when you wield them.

optionalfeature.name: Akimbo Shooting
entries: You can engage in two-weapon fighting even if one or both weapons are ranged. In addition, you do not need a hand free to load ammunition into ranged weapons (you still require two hands to use weapons with the two-handed property).

optionalfeature.name: Prone Fighting
entries: Being {@condition prone|xphb} does not impose disadvantage on your weapon attack rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Blast
entries: When you cast Eldritch Blast, you can change the damage type to acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. If you cast multiple beams, you can choose the damage type of each beam individually.

optionalfeature.name: Wings of Flight

item: A Backpack, Cloak or Suit of Armor (requires attunement)

entries: This pair of wood, leather and metal wings grants the wearer a fly speed of 20ft, provided they are not wearing heavy armor. In addition, the wearer has advantage on Dexterity saving throws while being held aloft by these wings.
This fly speed increases to 30ft when you reach 10th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Tool

item: a set of artisan tools or a musical instrument

entries: This magic tool or instrument grants a +2 bonus to ability checks made using it.
This bonus increases to +4 when you reach 10th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Cavalier
entries: You can cast the {@spell find steed|phb} spell using a warlock spell slot.

If you use {@variantrule find steed variant|J:Steeds}, you can choose one of the {@filter new steeds|bestiary|source=j:steeds|miscellaneous=} when you take this invocation (Your DM may allow additional steeds).

optionalfeature.name: Bloodletting Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack roll using a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can expend one Superiority Die to attempt to give the target a bleeding wound. Add the Superiority Die to the attack's damage roll. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw or begin {@condition bleeding|J:General}.

entries.name: Deep Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison and cold damage.

entries.name: Depth Diver
entries: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet, and you can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Ocean Dwarf Combat Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light crossbow|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, {@item spear|phb}, {@item trident|phb}, {@item net|phb}, and {@item warhammer|phb}.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

entries.name: Stonecunning
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin of stonework, such as ancient columns or statues, you are considered proficient in the {@skill History} skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Age
entries: A typical cannon is between two and three years old. The maximum cannon lifespans remains a mystery; so far, cannons have shown no signs of deterioration due to age. You are immune to magical aging effects.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most cannons take comfort in order and discipline, tending toward law andneutrality. But some have absorbed the morality, or lack thereof, of the beings with which they served.

entries.name: Size
entries: Cannons stand just over 2 feet tall and average about 20 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common. You can also speak using your Machine Speech trait.

entries.name: Machine Speech
entries: Machine Speech is a series of beeps at varying pitch and length. At the DM's discretion, certain other creatures may understand or speak this language.

entries.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: You were created to have remarkable fortitude, represented by the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and you have resistance to {@condition poison|phb} damage.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You are immune to disease.
You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Sentry's Rest.
entries: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you {@condition unconscious|phb}, and you can see and hear as normal.

entries.name: Natural Armor.
entries: Due to the shape of your body, you are ill-suited to wearing armor and gain no benefit from wearing it. Your body provides ample protection, however; your base armor class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

entries.name: Force Ballista.
entries: You know the {@spell Tin's Force Ballista|Jackalope} cantrip.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this cantrip when you cast it with this trait (choose when you select this race).
Eldritch Cannons are the living weapons of artificers. Most are simple unthinking machines but, in rare circumstances, a cannon may gain sentience and free will, becoming an Awakened Cannon.
Cannons come in all manner of sizes and shapes, despite this, they are treated as humanoids and are capable of all the actions of typical humanoids.

entries.name: Age
entries: A halfling reaches adulthood at the age of 20 and generally lives into the middle of his or her second century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Unlike most halflings, leprechauns are often mischievous and chaotic in nature.

entries.name: Size
entries: Halflings average about 3 feet tall and weigh about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Halfling. The Halfling language isn't secret, but halflings are loath to share it with others. They write very little, so they don't have a rich body of literature. Their oral tradition, however, is very strong. Almost all halflings speak Common to converse with the people in whose lands they dwell or through which they are traveling.

entries.name: Fey
entries: Your creature type is fey, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Lucky
entries: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

entries.name: Brave
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Halfling Nimbleness
entries: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

entries.name: Little Cobbler
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item cobbler's tools|phb}.

entries.name: Pot O' Gold
entries: You have access to a personal demiplane in which you can store treasure. As an action you can transfer a tiny, non-magical object, or up to 50 coins, from your hand to the demiplane. The demiplane can hold up to five pounds of non-magical objects (coins do not count towards this limit). While in the demiplane, the contents weigh nothing and can only be retrieved by you as an action. When you are reduced to 0 hit points, the contents spill out into a space within 5ft. of you.

entries.name: Fey
entries: Your creature type is fey, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the charmed condition on yourself.

entries.name: Wild Spirit
entries: You know the {@spell druidcraft|phb} cantrip.

entries.name: Dryad Magic
entries: You can cast the {@spell animal friendship|phb}, {@spell charm person} and {@spell entangle} spells with this trait and without material components. Once you cast any of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

Dryads are the spirits of trees manifested in near humanoid form, typically with a feminine appearance. They are often found has protectors of woodland areas, overseeing the trees and beasts and protecting them from encroaching wildfires, hunters and deforestation.

Dryads souls are tied to the trees they spawn from. Maturing, aging and typical lifespans vary between dryads and between regions in the multiverse. In some places each dryad's life force is directly tied to a specific tree, they mature age and die along with the tree and vice versa. In others, the connection is more indirect, with their lifespans mimicking the species they spawn from. For example, a weeping willow dryad might live only a few decades, while an oak dryad might live several centuries.

entries.name: Dryads across the multiverse
entries: In Cyranos in Alvergia, they are often found in tribes led by a queen and are known to mingle with tribes of satyrs, centaurs and wood elves. Dryads are also found frequently on the Isle of Pan.
In Caligos, dryads are often seen as a chaotic people and distrusted in the Caligos Imperium. Many feel safer and more comfortable in Sudenberg, which is friendlier to nature and chaos.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid. You are also considered an elf for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be an elf.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of yourself as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition charmed} condition on yourself.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Radiant Resistance
entries: You have resistance to radiant damage.

entries.name: Divine Dash
entries: As a bonus action, you can rapidly move up to 30 feet in a straight line in any direction. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks and you can pass through the space of other creatures. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

When you reach 3rd level, you can enhance your Divine Dash trait at the end of a long rest with an additional effect from the list below. The effect lasts until the end of your next long rest. If the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (choose when you select this race):

items.name: Forceful Dash.
items.entry: Any creatures who's space you pass through, and that are your size or smaller, must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: Healing Dash.
items.entry: Any creatures who's space you pass through regain a number of hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus.

items.name: Radiant Dash.
items.entry: Any creatures who's space you pass through take radiant damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Trance
entries: You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you remain conscious.

Whenever you finish this trance, you can change the effect for your Divine Dash trait, and you can gain two proficiencies that you don't have, each one with a weapon or a tool of your choice selected from the Player's Handbook. You mystically acquire these proficiencies by drawing them from shared elven memory, and you retain them until you finish your next long rest.

Just as many elves have their origins from the feywild, celestial elves instead claim similar from the upper planes and from celestial beings or even gods. Infused with divine and positive energies, celestial elves can propel themselves forward with the speed and strength of divine gods, unhindered by those in their way.

In Cyranos, some of these elves trace their lineage directly back to the first elves created by Prometheus and Athena. Some may even claim godly ancestry, being descended from demi-gods or even being demi-gods in their own right. This can be a source of great pride for many, perhaps too much for some. It can also be the source of great expectations and the stress of living up to them.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid. You are also considered an elf for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be an elf.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of yourself as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition charmed} condition on yourself.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Necrotic Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Revenant Dash
entries: As a bonus action, you can rapidly move up to 30 feet in a straight line in any direction. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks and you can pass through the space of other creatures. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

When you reach 3rd level, you can enhance your Revenant Dash trait at the end of a long rest with an additional effect from the list below. The effect lasts until the end of your next long rest. If the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (choose when you select this race):

items.name: Darkness Dash.
items.entry: You become {@condition invisible} until the end of the current turn. The effect ends early if you make an attack or cast a spell.

items.name: Fearful Dash.
items.entry: Any creatures who's space you pass through must make a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you until the end of their next turn.

items.name: Necrotic Dash.
items.entry: Any creatures who's space you pass through take necrotic damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Trance
entries: You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you remain conscious.

Whenever you finish this trance, you can change the effect for your Revenant Dash trait, and you can gain two proficiencies that you don't have, each one with a weapon or a tool of your choice selected from the Player's Handbook. You mystically acquire these proficiencies by drawing them from shared elven memory, and you retain them until you finish your next long rest.

Revenant elves have been touched by the realms of the dead. They may have returned from the dead, made a pact with some being to save them from death, been cursed with a form of undeath or simply have inherited blood or memories from elves that have done so. With this unusual nature, they can propel themselves forward, unhindered by living beings in their path.

In Cyranos, revenant elves or their ancestors may have been rescued from the underworld by great heroes like those of old. They may also be agents of Hades, Persephone or one of the many celestial, fiendish and primordial beings trapped in the Underworld or Tartarus, sent out into the world for whatever purpose.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are an Elemental.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Small or Medium. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of yourself as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries: You can squeeze through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide, provided you are wearing and carrying nothing but a mask. You also have advantage on ability checks you make to initiate or escape a {@action grapple}.

entries.name: Inorganic Resillience
entries: You have resistance to poison damage and have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}.

entries.name: Reactive Reformation
entries: When you take bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage, you can use a reaction to gain resistance to the triggering damage for the attack by briefly dispersing part of your form. When you do so, you are {@condition slowed|J:general} until the end of your next turn as your body must reform before moving again.

entries.name: Smoky Nature
entries: You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe. In addition, you can {@action Hide} while lightly obscured by smoke, fog or mist, provided you you are wearing and carrying nothing but a mask.

entries.name: Wonder of Wind
entries: You have proficiency in a wind instrument of your choice, such as the {@item bagpipes|PHB}, {@item flute|PHB}, {@item horn|PHB}, {@item panflute|PHB} or {@item shawm|PHB}. In addition, when you make an ability check to play such instruments, you gain a bonus to the roll equal to your Constitution modifer.

Wispers are amorphous beings of smoke and vapour. The origins of these people are a mystery, even to them. Many do not recall how they came to be, though some allegedly have fuzzy images of lives before their current ones, lives in which they were composed of flesh. Such stories only fuel asumptions that wispers are ghosts, though many scholars believe that they are not so.

Despite their lack of hard limbs and appendages, wispers are still capable of dexterous and forceful manipulations of the physical world. They can still pick up and use items and wear clothing, even if the manner in which they do so may appear different to how most humanoids would. Typically, most wispers will resemble humanoid forms with a torso, head and no more than two arms or legs.

Due to their composition, many wispers struggle to form faces that are defined and opaque enough to even be percieved as faces, leading to much confusion when communicating. For this reason, alongside fashion, many wispers adopt a practice of wearing masks, or even helmets, of ceramic, metal or wood. The simplest versions of these masks are static and provide little more than a form of visual identity and a place to look when conversing. Some wispers take to carrying multiple masks to non-verbally communicate multiple emotions. Others might acquire more elaborate mechanical or magical masks capable of more animated expression. Some decorate their mask with patterns as a form of artistic or cultural expression, in a similar manner to hairstyles or tattoos. For similar reasons, wispers may even employ prostetic hands and limbs, allowing them to gesture, even when such limbs lack functionality. More extreme cases may even have them piloting entire suits of armor, making them indistiguishable from solid humanoids.

entries.name: Wispers across the multiverse
entries: Wispers are rare in Alvergia, exsiting primarily in regions of chaotic fire and magic, such volcanoes on the Lonely Islands or deep in the forest of Muhai.

In Caligos, Wispers are considers monsters of chaos by the Caligos Imperium and are often arested on sight, or worse. It is not lost on some that the Inquisitors of Caligos wear masks and their unique magics have a smoky appearance to them. This naturally leads to rumours regarding the nature and orgin of the inquisitors and their magic. Such theories are considered heresy and severely punished. Wispers are still exetremly rare but can enjoy slightly warmer welcomes elsewhere, however, being mysterious creatures of fog, they can often startle and panic sailors who fear they might orginate from the Great Fog itself.

spell.name: Time Stasis
entries: This spell lets you freeze a creature or object in time. Choose a creature, of size Large or smaller, or a non-magical object, that is not greater than 10ft in any dimension, that you can see within range. If the target is a creature or is an object carried or worn by a creature, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be frozen in time for the spell's duration.
While frozen, a target is {@condition incapacitated|phb}, can't move or speak, and is unaware of its surroundings. It is also unaffected by any external forces such as gravity, attacks and spells.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can affect one additional creature or object for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Tin's Force Ballista
entries: You fire a small dart of magically compressed matter at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 1d8} force damage. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 5 feet in a straight line away from you.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Boomerang Blade

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You launch the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a ranged attack with it against a creature you can see within 30 feet of you, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, and takes an additional {@dice 1d4} force damage. Hit or miss the weapon then returns to your hand.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Reverse Teleport
entries: You choose a creature you are familiar with. If the creature is willing, is on the same plane of existence as you and is not {@condition incapacitated}, they are then instantly transported to a space within 10 feet of you.
The creature instinctively understands that the spell will transport them and recognizes you as the caster if it knows you but it does not know where it will transported to.

spell.name: Arcane Mirror
entries: You create a magic, spectral mirror, that is no larger than 5 feet in any dimension, at a point you can see within range. Whenever a spell, that is cast in a line, hits the mirror, it is reflected at an angle of your choice for the remainder of its range and the mirror is destroyed. If this would result in a creature or object being hit by the spell multiple times, they are subjected to the effects of the spell for each time.
On each of your turns after you cast this spell, you can use a bonus action to move the mirror up to 30 feet in any direction. If the mirror is ever more than 30 feet from you, it is destroyed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can create two mirrors simultaneously and move them both independently with the same bonus action. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you can create and control up to three mirrors simultaneously.

spell.name: Bazoz's Spicy Water
entries: You choose a volume of liquid that is primarily water, that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. The liquid may be separated into multiple groups or containers, provided they still fit within the 5-foot cube. You produce up to three of the following effects in the liquid for the spell's duration.

items: You fill the liquid with faintly glowing bubbles. You choose the color, size and density of these bubbles.
You make the liquid move in a simple repeating pattern, such as a small whirlpool, fountain or convection current. This movement is not strong enough to move or harm creatures or objects.
You make the liquid slowly change color or opacity every few seconds. In addition, you can make the liquid glow, producing dim light within 10ft.

You give the liquid a smell, flavor and temperature of your choice. The temperature change cannot be so great that the liquid would boil, freeze, or be directly harmful to creatures it wasn't previously.
You increase or decrease the potency of any non-magical substances in the liquid, such as alcohol or caffeine. You cannot alter the effects of poisons or potions in this way.
You alter the buoyancy of tiny objects or creatures in the liquid. This effect cannot move an unwilling creature or alter a creature's movement speed in the liquid.

entries: You may also suggest additional effects if your DM allows. None of the effects may directly harm or move creatures. You can dispel any of the effects you created at any point (no action required).
The maximum duration of this spell increases up to 24 hours when you reach 5th level, up to 7 days at 11th level, and up to 1 year at 17th level.

spell.name: Greater Ceremony

components.m: 500 gp worth of powdered silver, which the spell consumes

entries: You perform a special religious ceremony that is infused with magic. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following rites, the target of which must be within 10 feet of you throughout the casting.
{@b Communion.} You touch one humanoid who wishes to speak directly to your god. They can cast the {@spell commune|phb} spell once as a ritual and without providing material components.

{@b Last Will and Testament.} You touch a humanoid that wishes to leave possessions with another when they die. The target names a creature they are familiar with to be their heir. When the target dies, their body, along with any items they are wearing or carrying, are transported magically to a space within 5ft of the heir, even across planes. If the heir themselves is dead, the items do not teleport. A target can gain this rite again to change their designated heir, they may only have one heir at a time. The target loses this rite when they die.

{@b Oath of Friendship.} You touch two humanoids who wish to never harm one another. These targets are permanently {@condition charmed} by each other (even if they are otherwise immune to the charmed condition) and cannot perform any action that would directly harm the other, even if compelled to do so by any means short of a {@spell wish|phb} spell. A target can only benefit from this rite once and loses it if either of the targets dies.

{@b Procreation.} You touch adult humanoids who wish to have a child together, regardless of their number, their fertility or the combination of their races and sexes. One of the targets becomes pregnant. Alternatively, an egg or artificial womb is created externally within 10 feet of you. After an appropriate amount of time (or {@dice 2d6+2} months), a child is born or hatches. The race and statistics of the child are decided by the DM. A target can only benefit from this rite again after the child is born, hatched or dies.
{@b Purity Ward.} You touch one humanoid that wishes to remain pure. The target is immune to disease, immune to lycanthropy and can't become undead by any means short of a {@spell wish|phb} spell.

{@b Standing Vigil.} You touch one humanoid who wishes to protect a particular creature, location or object. While they are within 30ft of the subject of their protection, they do not need to eat, drink or sleep and when they take a long rest, they appear inert and motionless but are not rendered {@condition unconscious|phb}, and they can see and hear as normal. A creature can benefit from this rite only once and loses the rite if the subject of their protection dies or is destroyed.

{@b Transition.} You touch one humanoid that wishes to permanently change their age, appearance, race or sex. The target describes what they wish to be and, if the DM allows, they are then transformed. If the target changes race, they take on the racial traits and ability score improvements of their new race and discard the ones of their previous race. If the target's current form is the result of a curse or other magic effect, this rite has no effect until the curse or effect is removed. A creature can only benefit from this rite once.

{@b Undying Devotion.} You touch a target who wishes to serve your god, even after death. If a spell, such as {@spell raise dead|phb}, has the sole effect of restoring them to life (but not undeath), the caster doesn't need material components to cast the spell on them. A creature can benefit from this rite only once and loses the rite once it is used.

spell.name: Dark Ceremony

components.m: 25 gp worth of humanoid blood or bone dust, which the spell consumes

entries: You perform a special occult ceremony that is infused with magic. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following rites, the target of which must be within 10 feet of you throughout the casting. A creature must have an intelligence of 4 or greater and understand at least one language to benefit from a rite and can only benefit from one rite at a time.

entries.name: Blood Bond
entries: You touch two creatures willing to be bound in blood. For the next 7 days, when one of the creatures takes damage and can be seen by the other creature within 30 feet, the second creature can use a reaction to take half of the damage themself instead. A creature can benefit from a bond with each other creature only once.

entries.name: Embrace Curse
entries: You touch a willing creature that bears a curse or is attuned to a cursed item. For the next 24 hours, or until the curse is removed, whenever the target makes an ability check, it can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the Ability Check. Additionally, the creature is immune to the {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} spell for the duration. A creature can benefit from this rite only once per curse.

entries.name: Hellfire
entries: You touch up to two flasks of alcohol, blood or ichor and cause each to become a flask of {@item Alchemist's Fire|XPHB}.

entries.name: Nightwalking
entries: You touch a willing creature. For the next 24 hours that creature has advantage on Ability Checks while in dim light or darkness but has disadvantage on Ability Checks and attack rolls while in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Minor Pact
entries: You touch a willing creature that makes a pact with an otherworldly entity, such as a fey, fiend or aberration. For the next 24 hours, the creature deals an additional {@dice 1d4} cold, fire, poison or psychic (choose when you perform this rite) damage with weapon attacks. A creature can benefit from this rite only once.

entries.name: Serve in Death
entries: You touch a willing creature. For the next 7 days, if that creature is reduced to 0 hit points, they immediately die and are reanimated as a {@creature zombie|xphb} bound to your service for 24 hours, after which the zombie dies. The creature retains its Proficiency Bonus, proficiencies and skills, but otherwise its statistics are replaced by that of the zombie. The target can only be resurrected with spells such as {@spell Resurrection|XPHB} once the zombie dies. A creature can benefit from this rite only once.

entries.name: Split Tongue
entries: You touch a willing creature. For the next 24 hours, that creature can add a {@dice 1d4} bonus to Ability Checks they make to lie to or coerce others. They also have a {@dice 1d4} penalty to all other Charisma checks.

entries.name: Thirsting Fury
entries: You touch a willing creature. For the next 24 days, when the creature rolls {@variantrule Intiative|XPHB}, it can choose to become {@condition Berserk|J:General|Beserk (5)} for 1 minute. While {@condition Berserk|J:General}, it deals an additional {@dice 1d6} damage with melee weapon attacks.

entries.name: Unyiedling Grasp
entries: You touch a willing creature and an item they are holding and do not wish to lose. For the next 7 days, the creature cannot willingly let go of the item, even if they are {@condition Unconscious|XPHB}, dead, or compelled to do so by a spell of 5th-level or lower. Whenever they would be disarmed of it, they can choose to take {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage instead of releasing the item.

spell.name: Wild Ceremony

components.m: 25 gp worth of herbs and totems, which the spell consumes

entries: You perform a special ceremony that is infused with primal power. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following rites, the target of which must be within 10 feet of you throughout the casting.

entries.name: Earthly Gift
entries: You touch fertile dirt and grow a plant within the area that produces one of the following; a {@item Club|XPHB}, a {@item Staff|XPHB}, a {@item Shortbow|XPHB}, a {@item Longbow|XPHB}, a {@item Wand|XPHB} or a {@item Sprig of Mistletoe|XPHB}. For the next 24 hours, when a creature that is holding the item rolls Initiative, they gain {@dice 2d6} Temporary Hit Points. You can only use this rite once every 7 Days.

entries.name: Friend of the Wilds
entries: You touch a willing humanoid. For the next 7 days, that creature can add a {@dice 1d4} bonus to Intelligence (Nature) and Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks. Additionally, {@variantrule Hostile[Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} beasts will become {@variantrule Indifferent[Attitude]|XPHB|Indifferent} to the creature unless the beast, or its allies are threatened by the creature or influenced by another.

entries.name: Nature's Shroud
entries: For the next 7 days, the spell's area becomes lightly camouflaged by leaves, vines and other natural elements. Creatures other than those within the area during the spell's casting, have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Ability Checks made to find or notice the area and objects within it. This rite has no effect if the area is surrounded by unnatural elements, such as being inside a building or developed town. You can only use this rite once every 7 Days.

entries.name: Primordial Potioncraft
entries: You touch a body of water or a flowering plant and produce a vial of {@item Antitoxin|XPHB} or two vials {@item Perfume|XPHB}.

entries.name: Return to Earth
entries: You touch the corpse of a beast or humanoid and cause it to rapidly decay into dust or dirt, which then seeps into the ground. Over the next few weeks, flowers grow especially in the spell's area.

entries.name: Safe Travels
entries: You touch a willing humanoid embarking on a journey and choose a type of terrain; arctic, coast, desert, forest, grassland, mountain, ocean, swamp, or the underdark. For the next 7 days, the creature can add a {@dice 1d4} bonus to Ability Checks made to navigate or find food in the chosen terrain. A creature can benefit from this rite once at a time, gaining this rite again ends the previous one.

spell.name: Spectral Crew

components.m: a piece of debris from a shipwreck

entries: You touch a non-magical ship and summon up to 10 spectral sailors to crew it for the spell's duration. These spectral sailors do not fight or perform any actions not directly related to crewing the ship, but they are added to the crew numbers of the ship for the purposes of determining possible ship actions and will obey a captain's orders. This spell ends early if you are ever more than 100ft from the ship.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you summon up to 10 additional sailors for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ray of Impotence
entries: Choose one of the following damage types; acid, cold, fire, lightning, force, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target deals only half damage with chosen damage type until the spell ends.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Ray of Lumbering
entries: Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Dexterity until the spell ends.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Rising Words
entries: You target a creature in range and utter a phrase or joke so abhorrent to the creature that you awaken a furious anger inside them. The targeted creature can immediately use a reaction (even if they are {@condition unconscious}) to move up to its movement speed toward you, without provoking opportunity attacks, before making an unarmed strike against you.

The target can choose to use your spellcasting ability modifier in place of its Strength modifier for the attack roll and damage. On a hit, you suffer the attack's normal effects and the creature regains hit points equal to twice the damage dealt.
If the targeted creature is {@condition unconscious} and does not hit you with an attack, or still has 0 hit points after the attack, it remains {@condition unconscious} once the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the amount of hit points regained by the creature on a hit increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Runner's Rope
entries: You fire a magical dart at an object you can see within range that is Huge or larger, or that is fixed in place (such as a wall or ceiling). The dart remains fixed to the target for the spell's duration, and a 60-foot long magic rope extends from the dart to your empty hand. You have advantage on Strength (Athletics) and Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks you make using the rope.
When you cast the spell, or as a subsequent bonus action on each of your turns for the spell's duration, you can touch the rope and perform one of the following actions:

items: {@b {@i Reel In.}} You reduce the length of the rope by up to 30 feet. Any creatures grasping the rope are moved towards the dart by a number of feet equal to the number you reduce the rope by, following the path of the rope. A creature that is not {@condition restrained} by the rope can let go of the rope at any point during this movement to stop moving.
{@b {@i Reel Out.}} You extend the length of the rope by up to 30 feet (to a maximum of 120 feet).
{@b {@i Reshoot.}} The dart and rope vanish, and you fire a new dart at a new target within range.

spell.name: Chain Blade

components.m: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You touch the weapon used in the spell's casting and chains extend from your wrist to the weapon. Until the start of your next turn, that weapon's reach is 5 feet greater than normal.

This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, melee attacks with the weapon deal an extra {@dice 1d4} force damage to the target on a hit. This damage increases by {@dice 1d4} at 11th level ({@dice 2d4}) and 17th level ({@dice 3d4}).

spell.name: Caustic Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a weapon or an unarmed strike

entries: As you hit the creature, your weapon emits a burst of caustic acid, and the attack deals an extra {@dice 1d6} acid damage to the target. Each creature other than you that is within 5 feet of the target (including the target) must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 1d6} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, both the initial damage and the damage dealt to creatures within 5 feet increase by {@dice 1d6} each for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Merciful Touch

components.m: A coin worth at least 1cp which the spell consumes and a bowl

entries: You touch a willing creature and imbue them with the magic of mercy. For the duration, when the target reduces a creature to 0 hit points, they can choose to incapacitate the creature rather than killing them. The creature is {@condition unconscious} and stable.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Explosive Propulsion

components.m: a pinch of metallic powder and a fuse

entries: You touch a willing creature and choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant or thunder. The target gains a flying speed of 40 feet for the duration, as if propelled by matter or energy of the chosen type. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft, unless it can stop the fall.

Additionally, for the spell's duration, if the target flies 15ft or more in a straight line immediately before making a melee attack or impacting a solid surface, such as the ground or a wall, they can choose to emit a blast of destructive energy. Any creatures within 10ft of the target (excluding the target itself) must make a must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 3d6} damage of the chosen type on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage dealt by the burst increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Silencing Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a weapon or an unarmed strike

entries: As you hit the creature, your weapon utters a harsh, shushing noise, and the attack deals an extra {@dice 2d6} psychic damage to the target. Additionally, the target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be {@condition silenced|j:general} until the spell ends.

spell.name: Timber

components.m: a twig from a large tree

entries: You rapidly transform yourself into a tree and slam downwards, crushing those beneath you. Each creature in a 20-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 3d8} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and is not knocked prone.
When the spell ends, you transform back into your original form. You can remain in the same space or choose to reappear in an unoccupied space of your choice within the spell's area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can transform into a larger tree, increasing the area of this spell to a 30-foot cone (4th-level), 40-foot cone (6th level) or a 60-foot cone (8th-level).

spell.name: Crackling Bolt
entries: A bolt of lightning shoots towards a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 1d8} lightning damage, and it has disadvantage on the next Dexterity saving throw it makes before the end of its next turn.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Flaming Fingers
entries: A flickering flame appears in your hand. The flame remains there for the duration and harms neither you nor your equipment. The flame sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The spell ends if you dismiss it as an action or if you cast it again.
When you cast the spell, or as a subsequent action while you have this flame, you can produce one of the following effects with it:

items: You double or halve the area of bright light and dim light cast by the flame, change its color, or both.

You ignite a flammable object you touch that is not being worn or carried by a creature other than you. Once the object is ignited, you can immediately pull your hand away to avoid taking fire damage as a result of touching the burning object.

You cause simple shapessuch as the vague form of a creature, an inanimate object, or a locationto appear within the flames and animate as you like. The shapes must fit in your hand (or just above it) and last until the start of your next turn.
You cool the flame and safely dry up to a square foot of a wet creature or object you touch without burning it.

entries: {@note If you use the Evolving Cantrips supplement, you gain the following additional benefits when you reach certain levels.}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At 5th Level
entries: You can use the flame as an action to ignite a flammable object you can see within 15 feet of you that is not being worn or carried by a creature other than you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At 11th Level
entries: You can make up to two flames appear simultaneously, each in a different hand. You can produce simultaneous effects with each flame as part of the same action. You may choose the same effect or a different one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At 17th Level
entries: You can ignite up to three objects simultainiously with each flame.

spell.name: Speech Jam

components.m: a metal tube or horn bent into a loop

entries: You choose a target you can see within range and attempt to create a feedback loop between its speech and hearing, confusing its mind and forcing it to speak slower than normal. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw or become speech jammed for the spell's duration or until they are {@condition deafened}. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the effect on a success.

While speech jammed, the target speaks in a slow drawl. They have disadvantage on Charisma checks that rely on speech and they take longer to cast spells with verbal components. If the spell normally requires a reaction, they can no longer cast it. If the spell normally requires a bonus action, it now requires an action. If the spell normally requires an action, it now requires two actions.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shape Weapon

components.m: a piece of paper folded into the shape of a weapon

entries: You choose a nonmagical weapon that you can see in range and alter its geometry. You might make an edge sharper or duller, make a blade longer or shorter, alter the weight balance or another similar effect.

For the spell's duration, the weapon's damage type becomes your choice of bludgeoning, piercing or slashing and attacks with it have a {@dice 1d6} bonus or penalty (choose when you cast this spell) to damage rolls (to a minimum of 1 damage). If you choose to grant a bonus to damage, attacks with the weapon count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.
If the weapon is being worn or carried by an unwilling creature when you cast the spell, that creature can make a Charisma saving throw to prevent the effects of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at 5th-level or higher, you can add or remove one of the following properties on the weapon for every two levels above 3rd; heavy, finesse, light and reach. This effect lasts for the spell's duration.

spell.name: Bloat/Trim

components.m: a handful of blubber or lard

entries: You cause a creature or an object you can see within range to grow larger or smaller for the duration, modifying and redistributing its mass to help or hinder it. Choose either a creature or an object that is neither worn nor carried. If the target is unwilling, it can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell has no effect.
If the target is a creature, everything it is wearing and carrying changes size with it. Any item dropped by an affected creature returns to normal size at once.

entries.name: Bloat
entries: The target's size doubles in all dimensions, and its weight is multiplied by eight. This growth increases its size by one categoryfrom Medium to Large, for example. If there isn't enough room for the target to double its size, the creature or object attains the maximum possible size in the space available. Until the spell ends, the target also has disadvantage on Dexterity checks and Strength saving throws. The target's weapons also grow to match its new size, becoming unbalanced and unwieldy. While these weapons are bloated, the target has a {@dice 1d4} penalty to attack rolls with them.

entries.name: Trim
entries: The target's size is halved in all dimensions, and its weight is reduced to one-eighth of normal. This reduction decreases its size by one categoryfrom Medium to Small, for example. Until the spell ends, the target also has advantage on Dexterity checks and Strength saving throws. The target's weapons also shrink to match its new size, feeling lighter and handling easier. While these weapons are trimmed, the target has a {@dice 1d4} bonus to attack rolls with them.

spell.name: Overwatch

components.m: fine wire shaped into a cross or a set of glass lenses

entries: You choose a 15-foot cube centered on a point you can see within range. You can use a subsequent action on each of your turns to move the area to another point you can see within range.

Until the spell ends, whenever a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts it turn there, you can take a special opportunity attack against them using a ranged weapon or a weapon with the thrown property. This attack does not require a reaction, however, you must be able to see the creature and must not be {@condition incapacitated}. On a hit, the attack deals an additional {@dice 1d6} force damage.
The spell ends early once you make four attacks as part of this spell or if you end your turn without being able to see the area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the maximum number of attacks you can make as part of this spell without ending it increases by two for each each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Pheromone Strike

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a weapon or an unarmed strike

entries: As you hit the creature, the attack deals an additional {@dice 1d6} psychic damage and the creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. Beasts, monstrosities and plants have disadvantage on this saving throw. On a fail, the creature is {@condition taunted|J:general} by you for the spell's duration. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns or whenever it takes damage from a creature other than you, removing the condition on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the additional damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Growth Strike

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a weapon or an unarmed strike

components.m: a seed from a large plant

entries: As you hit the creature and that creature is within 5 feet of a surface, such as the ground or a wall, a plant erupts from the surface, striking the target before wilting and disappearing. The target takes an addtional {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage from the attack and must make a Strength saving throw. On a fail, the target is pushed 10 feet directly away from the surface. If multiple valid surfaces exist you choose which one the plant erupts from.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st. Additionally, when you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the target is pushed an addtional 10 feet on a fail.

spell.name: Detect Echoes
entries: Choose a creature type; aberration, beast, celestial, construct, dragon, elemental, fey, fiend, giant, humanoid, monstrosity, ooze, plant, or undead. For the spell's duration, you know if a creature of the chosen type has previously occupied a space within 30 feet during the last hour. You know the number of creatures, the spaces they occupied and how long ago they occupied them, however, you do not learn the identity of the creatures.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can choose an additional creature type per slot level above 2nd. You can sense the spaces occupied by creatures of all chosen types, and you can distinguish between the chosen types.

spell.name: Find Familiar (Revised)

m.text: 10 gp worth of charcoal, incense, and herbs that must be consumed by fire in a brass brazier

entries: You gain the service of a familiar, a spirit that takes the form of {@filter a Tiny or Small beast of your choice that has a CR of 1/4 or lower|bestiary|Challenge Rating=[&0;&1/4]|type=beast|miscellaneous=|size=t;s}. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the familiar has the statistics of the chosen form, though its creature type is one of the following of your choice; aberration, celestial, construct, elemental, fey, fiend, monstrosity, plant, ooze or undead. In addition, the familiar's proficiency bonus is equal to yours and its hit point maximum is equal to four times your proficiency bonus, unless it is already higher.

Additional form choices may be available at the DM's discretion, such as non beasts. On your travels, you may encounter remarkable creatures willing to become your familiar. At the DM's discretion, you can cast this spell over the course of 8 hours to bind a willing creature to your service. The creature must be no larger than Small, must not be a humanoid, must have a CR of 1/4 or less (or up to CR 1 if you have the Pact of the Chain feature) and must remain within 10 feet of you for the entire duration. You can then summon the creature, whenever you cast this spell. If the creature wishes to leave your service, it can do so at any time, after which you can no longer summon it.
Your familiar acts independently of you, but it always obeys your commands. In combat, it acts on your turn or immediately after it. A familiar can't attack, but it can take other actions as normal.

When the familiar drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. It reappears after you cast this spell again. As an action or bonus action, you can temporarily dismiss the familiar to a pocket dimension. Alternatively, you can dismiss it forever. As an action while it is temporarily dismissed, you can cause it to reappear in any unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. Whenever the familiar drops to 0 hit points or disappears into the pocket dimension, it leaves behind in its space anything it was wearing or carrying.

While your familiar is within 100 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. Additionally, as an action, you can see through your familiar's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the familiar has. During this time, you are {@condition deafened||deaf} and {@condition blinded||blind} with regard to your own senses.

You can't have more than one familiar at a time. If you cast this spell while you already have a familiar, you instead cause it to adopt a new form. Choose one of the forms from the above list. Your familiar transforms into the chosen creature.

Finally, when you cast a spell with a range of touch, your familiar can deliver the spell with its own touch. Your familiar must be within 100 feet of you, and it must use its reaction to deliver the spell when you cast it.

spell.name: Unreasonable Scale

m.text: A bone or other body part of a Gargantuan creature worth at least 500gp

entries: Choose a willing creature you can see within range. The target's dimensions all scale equally to become as large as the space available will allow (to a maximum of 25 feet in any dimension), along with all its equipment. Its size category also changes to reflect its new size, up to Gargantuan. The target also gains the following bonuses for the spell's duration, regardless of its size:

items: The target gains 50 temporary hit points and becomes resistant to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage. It loses any remaining temporary hit points when the spell ends.
The target's Strength score becomes 24 if it is not already higher and it has advantage on Strength checks and saving throws.
The target has advantage on attack rolls that use its Strength modifier, and these attacks deal an additional {@dice 1d8} force damage on a hit.

Whenever the target hits an object or creature with a melee attack, it can use a bonus action to deal {@dice 2d6} force damage to each creature and object within 5 feet of the attack's target, excluding the spell's target.

spell.name: Dominate Horde
entries: You attempt to beguile a swarm, or a group of up to five minions with the same statblock, that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for the duration. If you or creatures that are friendly to you are fighting the target, it has advantage on the saving throw. If the swarm or minions are beasts or humanoids, you ignore any immunity they have to the charmed condition.

While the target is {@condition charmed}, you have a telepathic link with it as long you are on the same plane of existence. You can use this telepathic link to issue commands to the target while you are conscious (no action required), which it does its best to obey. You can specify a simple and general course of action, such as "Attack that creature," "Run over there," or "Fetch that object." If the target completes the order and doesn't receive further direction from you, it defends and preserves itself to the best of its ability.

You can use your action to take total and precise control of the target. Until the end of your next turn, the target takes only the actions you choose, and doesn't do anything that you don't allow it to do. During this time, you can also cause the target to use a reaction, but this requires you to use your own reaction as well.

Each time the target takes damage, it makes a new Wisdom saving throw against the spell. If the saving throw succeeds, the spell ends. If the target dies before the spell ends, you can use an action on your next turn to target a new swarm or group of minions.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a 4th-level spell slot or higher, you can target an additional swarm or group of 5 minions with the same statblock for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Six Shots

m.text: a ranged or thrown weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You summon six spectral ranged or thrown weapons, such as firearms, crossbows or throwing knives, that float in the air surrounding you. Alternatively, you might summon six pieces of spectral ammunition for a ranged weapon you are holding. You then proceed to grab each weapon or ammunition and make a ranged spell attack with it. Each attack must target a different creature or object. On a hit, each attack deals {@damage 6d6} damage of one of the following types, you choose a different type for each attack; acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, radiant or thunder.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at 4th-level or higher, each attack deals an additional {@scaledamage 6d6|3-9|1d6} damage on a hit for every level above 3rd.

spell.name: Delver's Toolbag
entries: You are prepared for the obstacles and traps of dungeons and other dangerous locations. For the spell's duration, you can use a bonus action to summon, or dismiss, one of the following items:

items: A {@item crowbar|XPHB} or {@item miner's pick|PHB}.
A {@item torch|XPHB} and {@item tinderbox|XPHB}.
50 feet of {@item rope|XPHB} and a {@item grappling hook|XPHB} or {@item block and tackle|XPHB}.
A 10-foot {@item pole|XPHB}, {@item ladder|XPHB} or plank.
A lead weight, steel ball or bag of sand weighing up to 50 lbs.
A hunk of meat with 1 hit point. Magic effects and spells of 5th-level or lower cannot distiguish between it and a creature with the beast type.
A small minecart capable of carrying a 5-foot cube of material or a Medium or smaller creature along rails.

entries: The items created by this spell are clearly magical, you can wield them with ease regardless of their weight and size and you can throw an item up to 30 feet. You can have up to three items summoned by this spell simultaneously, summoning a fourth dismisses the oldest item. All items vanish when the spell ends.

spell.name: Summon Warrior

m.text: a banner or horn worth 300+ GP

entries: You call forth a humanoid warrior spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range and uses the {@creature Warrior Spirit|J:General} stat block. When you cast the spell, choose a form: Berserker, Scoundrel, or Sentry. The creature resembles a Humanoid creature of your choice marked by the chosen form, which determines certain details in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, the creature shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its movement to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.

spell.name: Summon Plant
entries: You call forth a plant spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range and uses the {@creature Plant Spirit|J:General} stat block. When you cast the spell, choose a form: Shrub, Tree, Vines. The spirit resembles a plant creature of your choice marked by the chosen form, which determines certain details in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, the creature shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its movement to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.

spell.name: Freeze Metal

components.m: a piece of iron and a flame

entries: Choose a manufactured metal object, such as a metal weapon or a suit of Heavy or Medium metal armor, that you can see within range. You cause the object to supercool and become brittle. If the object is not being worn or carried, it becomes {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB|Vulnerable} to Bludgeoning damage.

Any creature in physical contact with the object takes {@damage 2d8} Cold damage when you cast the spell. Until the spell ends, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on each of your later turns to deal this damage again if the object is within range.

If a creature is holding or wearing the object and takes the damage from it, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become unable to drop or doff the object, is {@condition Hampered|J:General} and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity checks and saving throws until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|2-9|1d8} for each spell slot level above 2.

vehicle.name: Rowboat

entries: 15 ft.
Move up to its speed, with one 90-degree turn. Without oars, the rowboat's speed is 0.

action: On its turn, the rowboat can take the move action below. It can't take this action if it has no crew.

items.name: Move.
items.entry: The rowboat can move using its oars.

vehicle.name: Catamaran

control.name: Helm
entries: Move up to the speed of one of its movement components, with one 90-degree turn. If the helm is destroyed, the ship can't turn.
20 ft. (requires at least 2 crew)
25 ft.; 15 ft. while sailing into the wind; 35 ft. while sailing with the wind.

action: On its turn, the catamaran can take 2 actions, choosing from the options below. It can take only 1 action if it has fewer than two crew. It can't take these actions if it has no crew.

items.name: Move.
items.entry: The ship can use its helm to move with its oars or sails.

entries: Whenever you hit with a critical hit using this weapon, the bonus to this weapon's attack and damage rolls increases by 1 (to a maximum of +10).

entries.name: Curse
entries: This weapon is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by a spell such as {@spell remove curse} or a similar effect. While cursed, whenever you hit with a critical hit using this weapon, your hit point maximum is reduced by {@dice 4d4}. If your hit point maximum is reduced to 0 or lower, you instantly die and your soul is consumed by the weapon, you can not be resurrected. If the curse is broken, the weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls is reduced to 0.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
When you hit a creature with this weapon, it whispers insults to them. If the hit is a critical hit, the insults are so damming that the creature takes an extra {@dice 1d6} psychic damage.

inherits.reqAttune: by a creature with a strength score of 13 or higher
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
When you attack with this weapon, you can use your Strength modifier, instead of Dexterity modifier, for the attack and damage rolls.

inherits.reqAttune: by a creature with a dexterity score of 13 or higher
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
When you attack with this weapon, you can use your Dexterity modifier, instead of Strength modifier, for the attack and damage rolls.

inherits.reqAttune: by a creature with a constitution score of 13 or higher
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
When you attack with this weapon, you can use your Constitution modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity modifier, for the attack and damage rolls.

inherits.reqAttune: by a creature with a intelligence score of 13 or higher
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
When you attack with this weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity modifier, for the attack and damage rolls.

inherits.reqAttune: by a creature with a wisdom score of 13 or higher
